body:
## Expected Behavior

When Cairo shifts to EEST (UTC+3) from EET (UTC+2), a cron job scheduled with `CRON_TZ=Africa/Cairo 59 9 * * *` should continue to execute at 09:59 AM on the local wall clock for Cairo, automatically adjusting for the time zone's offset change due to DST.

## Actual Behavior
Prior to Cairo's recent shift to summer time (DST), the cron job executed correctly at 09:59 AM every morning  Cairo local time. However, after Cairo transitioned to summer time (which involves moving clocks forward by one hour), the workflow now consistently executes at 10:59 AM Cairo local time, instead of the expected 09:59 AM.

## Specifications

  - Version: go.sdk@v1.16.0

comments.body: We are taking a look, thanks for reporting.

I'm guessing you're using an out-of-date tzdata database. Time zones for cron or schedules are handled by the Go standard library on the server, so it's the version of tzdata on the server that would be relevant. What server version are you using and how are you deploying it? It looks like Cairo's rules last changed in a 2023 update to tzdata.

@dnr, We are using Temporal `v1.19.1`, self-hosted on Google Cloud private clusters (not Temporal Cloud).
I checked the tzdata version inside one of our Temporal server pods, and it uses `tzdata-2022f-r0`, which predates the `2023` update that updated DST in Cairo.
Makes sense. If you update tzdata on your pods that should resolve the issue.

title: Cron Job Runs at Incorrect Local Time After DST Transition
